name: baobab
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a tree with a thick trunk (= main stem) that grows in Africa and Australia, and lives for a very long time: The tree, a baobab, is huge and ancient, with a massive trunk 30 feet around. Native species such as figs, baobabs and acacias are being re-planted in Kenya. Six of the eight species of baobab tree are unique to Madagascar.
MyLoupe/UIG/Universal Images Group/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesSome people claim it is necessary to cull the elephants because they are destroying woodland, including some 2,000-year-old thick-trunked baobabs.He became skilled at climbing baobab trees to get honey.In parts of East Africa, the baobab is valued chiefly for its fabulous size.
